Michelle Raszl, Librarian, Mt Everett

Mt. Everett Robotics Qualifies for Southern New England Championship:

For the second time in three years, Mt. Everett’s robotics program will be heading off to the VEX Southern New England Championship. This year the program was able to earn a spot in the 76-team field via its regional robot skills rankings. Robot skills rankings are a measurement of what a robot can accomplish in just 1 minute of driver control and 1 minute of autonomous programming. Robot skills runs as a companion competition to the standard tournament. Tournament rankings, robot skills rankings, and judged awards are all ways to qualify for the regional championship. Two years ago, the team qualified by winning several different tournaments on its way to ringing up a 50-8 record that season. The 2020 SNE Championship is a two-day tournament that will be held on March 14 & 15 in Worcester, MA. The top 11 teams will earn a spot in the VEX World Championship in April. Mt. Everett last qualified for the world championship in 2015. This program is sponsored in part by the Eagle Fund.
